items.title: Investigators Sift Through Plane Crash Wreckage in Louisville
items.summary: A departing UPS cargo plane caught fire and dropped an engine crashing in an industrial zone. At least 12 people were killed.

items.title: Challenging Trump, Pelosi Made History
items.summary: The first and only woman to be speaker of the House also was the most powerful and prominent woman in Washington to effectively confront President Trump.

items.title: Here Are Airports That Could Be Affected by the Air Traffic Slowdown
items.summary: The cuts to flights are expected to begin Friday and deepen over the weekend to reach a 10 percent reduction in air traffic.

items.title: A Prison Hospice Program in California Offers Care to Dying Inmates
items.summary: Most people who die in prison die alone. Programs like the one at California Medical Facility aim to prevent that.

items.title: Bishops With Ties to Trump Commission Criticize Treatment of Immigrants
items.summary: The Roman Catholic prelates cited detainees’ lack of access to religious sacraments like communion.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi Announces Retirement From Congress in 2027
items.summary: Representative Nancy Pelosi, the only female House speaker, said she will not run for re-election. She wielded immense power and became a Democratic icon, while she was demonized by conservatives.

items.title: ‘Iconic, heroic, trailblazing’: Democrats praise Pelosi’s work after she announces plan to retire – US politics live
items.summary: <p>House minority leader Hakeem Jeffries calls Pelosi ‘greatest Speaker of all time’ as she announces she will stand down in 2027</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/06/nancy-pelosi-retire-congress">Nancy Pelosi, a force on Capitol Hill for decades, to retire from Congress</a></p></li></ul><p>It’s now day 37 of the ongoing government shutdown, the longest on record, with both parties continuing to blame the other for the lapse in funding.</p><p>For his part, Donald Trump has turned his attention to the filibuster – the procedural mechanism that requires 60 votes in the Senate to end debate on a piece of legislation and bring it to the floor for a vote. He’s hammered home his wishes on Truth Social, and in front of lawmakers at a White House breakfast on Tuesday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/06/donald-trump-government-shutdown-venezuela-senate-vote-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US House panel requests interview with Andrew in Jeffrey Epstein investigation
items.summary: <p>Robert Garcia, top Democrat on House oversight panel, makes formal request in letter published Thursday</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/06/donald-trump-government-shutdown-venezuela-senate-vote-us-politics-live-news-updates">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li></ul><p>A US congressional panel investigating pedophile financier <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jeffrey-epstein">Jeffrey Epstein</a> has written to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk/prince-andrew">Andrew Mountbatten Windsor</a>, formerly Britain’s Prince Andrew, to ask that he submit to questioning as part of its investigation into Epstein’s criminal operations.</p><p>In a letter published on Thursday, California congressman Robert Garcia, the top Democrat on the House oversight committee, requested that <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk/prince-charles">King Charles III</a>’s younger brother help with its inquiry.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/06/epstein-andrew-interview-house-oversight-committee">Continue reading...</a>
